page.title: 12Cranbrook windmill
page.content: Cranbrook windmill,a fine example of a smock mill is situated near the centre of Cranbrook.It is open to the public on a saturday and on bank holidays.It is owned by the Cranbrook Windmill Association in conjunction with the Kent County Council.It is run by volunteers.The windmill was built in 1814 by the Millwright Humphrey for Henry Dobell.It was known as"Union Mill."In 1840 it was modernised by George Warren of Hawkhurst.He added a Fantail.The windmill is built of brick and weatherboard.It has a small balcony outside the windmill which is about in the middle of the windmill.It is a very sturdy building,which hasn't been wing for many years.Now the Cranbrook Windmill Association,which was formed in 1982 are restoring the windmill,so it will soon be in full working order. The windmill is an important landmark.
